metadata.title: CVE-2015-5195 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description:
ntp_openssl.m4 in ntpd in NTP before 4.2.7p112 allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (segmentation fault) via a crafted statistics orfilegen configuration command that is not enabled during compilation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5195` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.5
ntpdate - 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntp package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.5').
